oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Effect of Si substitution on the magnetic and magnetocaloric properties of ErCo2
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: SINGH, NK
TRIPATHY, SK
BANERJEE, D
TOMY, CV
SURESH, KG
NIGAM, AK
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The magnetic and magnetocaloric properties of Er(Co1-xSix)(2) compounds with 0less than or equal toxless than or equal to0.075 have been studied to determine their suitability as magnetic refrigerant materials. The strength of itinerant electron metamagnetism was found to decrease with Si concentration, which is responsible for the reduction of the magnetocaloric effect. Magnetization curves at low temperatures show the existence of a critical field for magnetization to increase, which is a consequence of domain wall pinning. The critical field and the coercive field were found to increase with Si concentration. (C) 2004 American Institute of Physics.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: 9th Joint Magnetism and Magnetic Materials Conference/ International Magnetics Conference,Anaheim, CA,JAN 05-09, 2004
